intro: Pacouria roxburghii, commonly known as the Indian star anise, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, star-shaped fruits that resemble those of the star anise. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers and has compound leaves with serrated edges. Its fruits are used in traditional medicine and as a spice due to their distinctive flavor and essential oils. Pacouria roxburghii thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shady environments.
